channel.title: coding on louis meunier
channel.description: Recent content in coding on louis meunier

item.title: üö≤ biking
item.description: source code live site An interactive map and analyzer of my bike rides. Data is automatically updated every time I enter a ride into Strava. The map is created with Leaflet, the site is made with Svelte, and the data is automatically synced to Firebase from Strava’s API.

item.title: ü§ñ BottingAtHome
item.description: source code A Discord bot for CubingUSA’s CubingAtHome (an online international Rubik’s Cube competition series) server, written in Javascript and hosted on Heroku. It was used primarily to provide basic utilities (such as scramble generation, event announcement, etc) to the server, and while CubingAtHome is no longer active, the bot is still active today! You can add it here.

item.title: ‚úâÔ∏è college email analysis
item.description: source code live site A set of scripts and website I created as a senior in high school to analyze the emails I received from colleges. The data was generated using the gmail API and ran automatically using Github Actions. The actual site is made with Svelte, and while the data isn’t updated anymore (as I, thankfully, no longer receive hundreds of college emails a week), the site is still live!

item.title: ‚å®Ô∏è ennuikeyboards
item.description: live site A portfolio website for a friend’s custom keyboard business. The site is made with NextJS and Firebase is used for authentication, database storage, analytics, etc.

item.title: cubing state explorer (WIP)
item.description: A graph of Rubik’s cube states, with the ability to explore the graph and find solutions to the cube. The cube images are generated using cubing.js. Currently, rather limited in any “practical” use, as the computation/comparison of any more than a few hundred states is very slow, but potentially pre-computing states could improve it.

item.description: top inspired by the artwork "Innumerable Life/Buddha" by Miyajima Tatsuo
